DataElement.preferredName: FACT-C Questionnaire Version 4 C7 How True Past Seven Days Like My Body Appearance Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how true in the past 7 days they like the appearance of their body, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-C Questionnaire Past Week How True Like My Body Appearance Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating the quality of life of colorectal cancer patients._The most recent week, including today._A survey question about a person's agreement with a statement._A question about whether an individual likes or liked the appearance of their body._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating the quality of life of colorectal cancer patients.

Concepts.definition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating the quality of life of colorectal cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How True Like My Body Appearance Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A survey question about a person's agreement with a statement.:A question about whether an individual likes or liked the appearance of their body.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.
A question about whether an individual likes or liked the appearance of their body.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: FACT-C:Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Colorectal, David Cella, Ph.D., Version 4, Nov. 2007
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards.  mc 12/17/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on FACT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: FACT-G:Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - General, David Cella, Ph.D., Version 4, Nov. 2007
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HQoL CRF Standardization project. mc 10/27/2014

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the  measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
